data.title: Did the Greeks lack cavalry in their military? Did this put them at a disadvantage when facing cavalry-heavy armies like the Persians, Ce...
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 2): Yes, more or less as also the Romans, but Greece (also Italy) is mostly a mountaineous area with small plains and that advantaged light and heavy infantry.

But Thessalians and Macedonians were famous for their cavalry. Alexander the Great was usually in command of the Macedonian...
